oh, thanks lynsey for the heads up!
How do we get to go to the Unconscious Bias training? i’d love to go.
Here is the link to toady’s session! <https://impactflow.com/event/techtown-portland-baseline-training-272>

attachments.title: TechTown Portland Baseline Training, Portland
attachments.text: Baseline Training SessionsOpen to All Employees of TechTown Diversity Pledge Companies3-4 hour sessions with multiple dates & times; see individual sessions for details; please select one session only.Conversations with the companies that have signed the TechTown Diversity Pledge have revealed a wide range of experiences and comfort on the topic of diversity in tech. In conversations with company executives we agreed that providing baseline training for employees of all diversity pledge companies would be a valuable resource.The desire to bring more diverse talent to the tech industry must be coupled with awareness efforts in order to more fully realize the benefits of an increasingly diverse workforce. The Baseline Training Sessions will establish a baseline level of awareness of the complexity of diversity and inclusion. The trainings will be particularly valuable for employees new to this topic, although they’re designed to provide value regardless of employee position within the organization, experience level with diversity, or identity as part of an underrepresented or dominant population.MONDAY, AUGUST 8, 2016 - 1:00 - 5:00 p.m.PDC, 222 NW Fifth Ave., First FloorThis interactive session led by Figure 8 Consulting helps identify barriers to inclusion and outstanding customer service, finding answers through an exploration of cultural agility and the development of true allyship. We partner with organizations to create unique solutions to the challenges they face. Our work is grounded in the belief that relationships are the foundation for cultural agility, and that cultural humility leads us to communicate better and to find ways to accommodate and find strength in our differences.
attachments.fallback: ImpactFlow: TechTown Portland Baseline Training, Portland

attachments.title: Relationship between Hungarian swimmer Katinka Hosszu and her husband Shane Tusup raises eyebrows at Rio Olympics
attachments.text: SHANE Tusup, the husband and coach of Hungarian swimmer Katinka Hosszu, has made headlines around the world for his euphoric celebration of his wife’s 400m individual medley win.
